required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Detemir Versus NPH for Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus in Pregnancy
clinical_study.official_title: Detemir Versus NPH for Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus in Pregnancy: a Comparative-effectiveness, Open Label, Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: To determine whether use of detemir compared to neutral protamine hagedorn (NPH) decreases rates of composite neonatal outcome and maternal hypoglycemia events in women with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Neonates With Composite Adverse Neonatal Outcome
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of delivery to the time of discharge (about 2-14 days)
primary_outcome.description: Composite Adverse Neonatal Outcome includes 1 or more of any of the following: Neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) admission or Neonatal hypoglycemia (<40 mg/dL in the first 24 hours of life and less than 50 mg/dL after) or requiring medical therapy or Respiratory distress (need for at least 4 hours of respiratory support with supplemental oxygen, continuous positive airway pressure or ventilation at the first 24 hours of life or Shoulder dystocia - defined as the need for any extra maneuvers, other than gentle downward traction of the fetal head in order to deliver the fetal body after the fetal head has been delivered or Large for gestational age (LGA) -weight over 90th percentile of the expected value according to gestational age or Macrosomia- Fetal weight above 4000g

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Maternal Subjects Who Experienced Hypoglycemic Events (<60 mg/dL) During Pregnancy
Change in Maternal Weight During Pregnancy
Number of Maternal Subjects Who Had Hypertensive Disorder During Pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Hypertensive disorder includes gestational hypertension, preeclampsia, or superimposed preeclampsia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Maternal Subjects Who Had Preeclampsia With Severe Features
Number of Subjects Who Had Cesarean Delivery
Number of Subjects Who Had Operative Vaginal Delivery
Number of Neonates Who Where Small for Gestational Age (SGA)
secondary_outcome.description: Small for gestational age (SGA) means that a fetus or an infant is smaller or less developed than normal for the baby's sex and gestational age. Small for gestational age (SGA) is defined as a birth weight that is below the 10th percentile.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of delivery to the time of discharge (about 2-14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: # of Neonates Who Had 5-minute Apgar Score < 7
secondary_outcome.description: The Apgar score is determined by evaluating the newborn baby on each of five criteria (appearance, pulse, grimace, activity, respiration) on a scale from zero to two, then summing the five values obtained. The total score ranges from zero to 10. A higher score indicates a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Neonates Who Had Jaundice Requiring Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of delivery to the time of discharge (about 2-14 days)

arm_group.description: NPH will peak between 4-12 hours after injection with a duration of action around 14 hours
Detemir is characterized by a gentle rise and fall with a longer duration of action (18-20 hours)

intervention.description: NPH will peak between 4-12 hours after injection with a duration of action around 14 hours
Detemir is characterized by a gentle rise and fall with a longer duration of action (18-20 hours)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Preexisting type 2 diabetes mellitus requiring medical treatment or
- overt diabetes diagnosed prior to 20 weeks of gestation using either Hemoglobin A1c (HBA1C) ≥ 6.5 or fasting glucose ≥126 mg/dl or random blood glucose ≥ 200 mg/dl or two step method ( 50g glucose challenge test (GCT) >135 mg/dl followed by 100 GCT with at least 2 values above thresholds: Fasting Blood Glucose (FBG) >90, 1 hr >180, 2 hr > 155, 3 hr > 140 mg/dl).
- Gestational age ≤20 weeks
- Willing to start insulin therapy or to continue insulin treatment during pregnancy
- Singleton or twin pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergy/prior adverse reaction to NPH/detemir
- Patients <18y
- Known major fetal anomalies
- Diabetic nephropathy (Creatinine (Cr)≥1.5)
- Diabetic proliferative retinopathy
- Patients with Type 1 diabetes or gestational diabetes

overall_official.affiliation: University of Texas Health Science Center of Houston

facility.name: University of Texas Health Science Center of Houston

results_reference.citation: Fishel Bartal M, Ward C, Blackwell SC, Ashby Cornthwaite JA, Zhang C, Refuerzo JS, Pedroza C, Lee KH, Chauhan SP, Sibai BM. Detemir vs neutral protamine Hagedorn insulin for diabetes mellitus in pregnancy: a comparative effectiveness, randomized controlled trial. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 2021 Jul;225(1):87.e1-87.e10. doi: 10.1016/j.ajog.2021.04.223. Epub 2021 Apr 15.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

Race/Ethnicity, Customized

Number of maternal participants who had private insurance for prenatal care

measure.description: Nulliparous means never given birth before.

measure.title: Number of maternal participants with body mass index (BMI) greater than 30
Number of maternal participants with diabetes mellitus diagnosed before pregnancy
Number of maternal participants with HbA1c level greater than 6.5%
measure.description: HbA1c level is percentage of red blood cells (RBCs) that have sugar attached to hemoglobin (Hb).

measure.title: Number of maternal participants with chronic hypertension
Number of maternal participants with depression or anxiety
Number of maternal participants with thyroid disease

Number of maternal participants who used aspirin during pregnancy

outcome.title: Number of Neonates With Composite Adverse Neonatal Outcome
outcome.description: Composite Adverse Neonatal Outcome includes 1 or more of any of the following: Neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) admission or Neonatal hypoglycemia (<40 mg/dL in the first 24 hours of life and less than 50 mg/dL after) or requiring medical therapy or Respiratory distress (need for at least 4 hours of respiratory support with supplemental oxygen, continuous positive airway pressure or ventilation at the first 24 hours of life or Shoulder dystocia - defined as the need for any extra maneuvers, other than gentle downward traction of the fetal head in order to deliver the fetal body after the fetal head has been delivered or Large for gestational age (LGA) -weight over 90th percentile of the expected value according to gestational age or Macrosomia- Fetal weight above 4000g
outcome.time_frame: From the time of delivery to the time of discharge (about 2-14 days)
outcome.population: All participants had singleton pregnancies (that is, there were no twins).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
